trans-unit.source: Start Workflow Accelerator

seg-source.mrk: Start Workflow Accelerator

trans-unit.source: After completing the installation as described above, both the MongoDB database and the Tomcat application server must be started for Workflow Accelerator to run properly. This section will give you more details on how to start them.

seg-source.mrk: After completing the installation as described above, both the MongoDB database and the Tomcat application server must be started for Workflow Accelerator to run properly.
This section will give you more details on how to start them.

trans-unit.source: Windows

seg-source.mrk: Windows

trans-unit.source: MongoDB

seg-source.mrk: MongoDB

trans-unit.source: If you followed the instructions in this guide and registered a service for MongoDB, you can simply start the MongoDB server by opening a command line with administrator privileges and execute the following command:

seg-source.mrk: If you followed the instructions in this guide and registered a service for MongoDB, you can simply start the MongoDB server by opening a command line with administrator privileges and execute the following command:

trans-unit.source: The registration also defined the startup type of the MongoDB service as “Automatic” which means it will start automatically if you restart the Windows system. Alternatively, you can manage the MongoDB service by opening the <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">services.msc</kbd>. There, MongoDB will be listed among the other services and can be started and stopped.

seg-source.mrk: The registration also defined the startup type of the MongoDB service as “Automatic” which means it will start automatically if you restart the Windows system.
Alternatively, you can manage the MongoDB service by opening the <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">services.msc</kbd>.
There, MongoDB will be listed among the other services and can be started and stopped.

trans-unit.source: Tomcat

seg-source.mrk: Tomcat

trans-unit.source: Assuming you installed Tomcat using the Windows service installer, you can open the Tomcat configuration dialog again by opening the Windows start menu and selecting <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">Program Files\Apache Tomcat\Configure Tomcat</kbd>. The tab General contains respective buttons to start and stop the Tomcat service.

seg-source.mrk: Assuming you installed Tomcat using the Windows service installer, you can open the Tomcat configuration dialog again by opening the Windows start menu and selecting <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">Program Files\Apache Tomcat\Configure Tomcat</kbd>.
The tab General contains respective buttons to start and stop the Tomcat service.

trans-unit.source: Furthermore, you have the option to define the startup type of the service. By default, this should be “Manual” which means you have to start the Tomcat server manually each time the server restarts. You can change the type to “Automatic”. Then the Tomcat server will start automatically each time you restart your Windows server.

seg-source.mrk: Furthermore, you have the option to define the startup type of the service.
By default, this should be “Manual” which means you have to start the Tomcat server manually each time the server restarts.
You can change the type to “Automatic”.
Then the Tomcat server will start automatically each time you restart your Windows server.

trans-unit.source: Script Engine

seg-source.mrk: Script Engine

trans-unit.source: If you installed the script engine and wrapped it into a service, you can open the <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">services.msc</kbd>, locate the Signavio Script Engine service and start it there. Otherwise open a command line, navigate to the <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">$SCRIPT_ENGINE_HOME</kbd> directory and execute:

trans-unit.source: Note, you cannot close the command line as long as the script engine is running.

trans-unit.source: Debian

seg-source.mrk: Debian

trans-unit.source: MongoDB

seg-source.mrk: MongoDB

trans-unit.source: If you followed the instructions in this guide to setup MongoDB using a packet manager, some additional scripts have been installed that allow you to start, stop and restart the database very easily. Be aware, the execution of those scripts require root privileges. :

seg-source.mrk: If you followed the instructions in this guide to setup MongoDB using a packet manager, some additional scripts have been installed that allow you to start, stop and restart the database very easily.
Be aware, the execution of those scripts require root privileges.

trans-unit.source: If MongoDB is already running, you can restart the database by executing:

trans-unit.source: Be aware, in earlier versions of MongoDB, e.g. 2.4.x, the scripts had a different name <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">/etc/init.d/mongodb</kbd>

seg-source.mrk: Be aware, in earlier versions of MongoDB, e.g. 2.4.x, the scripts had a different name <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">/etc/init.d/mongodb</kbd>

trans-unit.source: Tomcat

seg-source.mrk: Tomcat

trans-unit.source: The recommended way to install Tomcat is to use a packet manager. Installing Tomcat under Debian with APT will install additional scripts to start, stop and restart the server. Be aware, the execution of those scripts might require root privileges:
